eyefeatures.preprocessing package¶

Submodules¶

eyefeatures.preprocessing.aoi_extraction module¶

class eyefeatures.preprocessing.aoi_extraction.AOIExtractor(methods, x, y, window_size=None, threshold=None, pk=None, instance_columns=None, aoi_name=None, show_best=False)¶

Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

Extractor of areas of interest. Selects the partition into zones of interest with the lowest entropy.

Parameters:

  • methods (List[BaseAOIPreprocessor]) – list of aoi algorithms.

  • x (str) – x coordinate of fixation.

  • y (str) – y coordinate of fixation.

  • window_size (Optional[int]) – size of search window.

  • threshold (Optional[float]) – threshold density.

  • pk (Optional[List[str]]) – list of column names used to split pd.DataFrame for scaling.

  • instance_columns (Optional[List[str]]) – list of column names used to split pd.DataFrame into the similar instances for aoi extraction.

  • aoi_name (Optional[str]) – name of AOI column.

  • show_best (bool) – if true, then return the best method for each instance

__init__(methods, x, y, window_size=None, threshold=None, pk=None, instance_columns=None, aoi_name=None, show_best=False)¶

class eyefeatures.preprocessing.aoi_extraction.AOIMatcher(x, y, pk=None, instance_columns=None, aoi=None, n_aoi=0)¶

Bases: BaseEstimator, TransformerMixin

Matches AOI in the dataset.

Parameters:

  • x (str) – x coordinate of fixation.

  • y (str) – y coordinate of fixation.

  • pk (Optional[List[str]]) – list of column names used to split pd.DataFrame for scaling.

  • instance_columns (Optional[List[str]]) – list of column names used to split pd.DataFrame into the similar instances for aoi extraction.

  • aoi (Optional[str]) – name of AOI column.

  • n_aoi (int) –

    count of aoi in the group

    0: any number the areas of interest

    all integer number that greater than 0: count of the areas of interest.

class eyefeatures.preprocessing.aoi_extraction.GradientBased(x=None, y=None, window_size=None, threshold=None, pk=None, aoi_name=None)¶

Bases: BaseAOIPreprocessor

Defines the AOI for each fixation using a gradient-based algorithm. Finds the local maximum, pre-threshold it, and uses it as a center of aoi. After that, uses the Sobel operator to compute the gradient magnitude for each point. Next, defines the queue of areas of interest. Algorithm of aoi defining:

  • Gets the point from the queue. It is a center

  • Looks at the points near the center

  • Tries to find the point with defined aoi and maximum gradient magnitude

  • Adds center to this aoi

  • Repeats for all points in the matrix

Parameters:

  • x (Optional[str]) – x coordinate of fixation.

  • y (Optional[str]) – y coordinate of fixation.

  • window_size (Optional[int]) – size of search window.

  • threshold (Optional[float]) – threshold density.

  • pk (Optional[List[str]]) – list of column names used to split pd.DataFrame.

  • aoi_name (Optional[str]) – name of AOI column.

__init__(x=None, y=None, window_size=None, threshold=None, pk=None, aoi_name=None)¶
_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>¶
_check_params()¶

Method checks that provided data is sufficient to conduct preprocessing.

class eyefeatures.preprocessing.aoi_extraction.OverlapCLustering(x=None, y=None, diameters=None, centers=None, pk=None, aoi_name=None, eps=0.0)¶

Bases: BaseAOIPreprocessor

Defines the AOI for each fixation using the overlapping clustering algorithm.

Parameters:

  • x (Optional[str]) – x coordinate of fixation.

  • y (Optional[str]) – y coordinate of fixation.

  • diameters (Optional[str]) – diameters of fixation.

  • centers (Optional[str]) – centers of fixation.

  • pk (Optional[List[str]]) – list of column names used to split pd.DataFrame.

  • aoi_name (Optional[str]) – name of AOI column.

  • eps (float) – additional length to sum of radius

__init__(x=None, y=None, diameters=None, centers=None, pk=None, aoi_name=None, eps=0.0)¶
_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>¶
_build_clusters(X)¶

First step of the overlapping clustering algorithm. Builds the clusters. If the fixation locates inside another one, then these fixations are in one aoi.

Return type:

DataFrame

_check_aoi()¶
_merge_clusters(X)¶

Second step of the overlapping clustering algorithm. Merges the clusters. Selects aoi with the most amount of fixation in itself. Creates the queue of fixation and starts the cycle of merging

Return type:

DataFrame

_preprocess(X)¶

Main method to preprocess fixations.

Return type:

DataFrame

_sklearn_auto_wrap_output_keys = {'transform'}¶
class eyefeatures.preprocessing.aoi_extraction.ShapeBased(x=None, y=None, shapes=None, aoi_name='AOI', pk=None)¶

Bases: BaseAOIPreprocessor

Defines AOI using the specified shapes

Parameters:

  • x (Optional[str]) – x coordinate of fixation.

  • y (Optional[str]) – y coordinate of fixation.

  • aoi_name (str) – name of AOI column.

  • pk (Optional[List[str]]) – list of column names used to split pd.DataFrame.

  • shapes (Optional[List]) –

    list of shapes. It should be a list of tuple lists. Parameters for shape:

    0: ‘r’, ‘c’, ‘e’: rectangle, circle, ellipse

    For the rectangle:

    1: coordinates of the lower left corner of the rectangle.

    2: coordinates of the upper right corner of the rectangle.

    For the circle:

    1: coordinates of the center of the circle.

    2: radius of the circle.

    For the ellipse:

    ((x - x’)*cos(alpha) + (y - y’)*sin(alpha))**2 / a**2 + (-(x - x’)*sin(alpha) + (y - y’)*cos(alpha))**2 / b**2 = c

    1: coordinates of the center of the ellipse (x’, y’).

    2: “a” in the ellipse equation

    3: “b” in the ellipse equation

    4: “c” in the ellipse equation

    5: angle of inclination of th ellipse in radians (alpha)

__init__(x=None, y=None, shapes=None, aoi_name='AOI', pk=None)¶
_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>¶

class eyefeatures.preprocessing.aoi_extraction.ThresholdBased(x=None, y=None, window_size=None, threshold=None, pk=None, aoi_name=None, algorithm_type='kmeans', threshold_dist=None)¶

Bases: BaseAOIPreprocessor

Defines the AOI for each fixation using density maximum and Kmeans. Finds local maximum, pre-threshold it, and uses it as a center of aoi

Parameters:

  • x (Optional[str]) – x coordinate of fixation.

  • y (Optional[str]) – y coordinate of fixation.

  • window_size (Optional[int]) – size of search window.

  • threshold (Optional[float]) – threshold density.

  • pk (Optional[List[str]]) – list of column names used to split pd.DataFrame.

  • aoi_name (Optional[str]) – name of AOI column.

  • algorithm_type (str) – type of clustering algorithm to use.

  • threshold_dist (Optional[float])

eyefeatures.preprocessing.blinks_extraction module¶

eyefeatures.preprocessing.blinks_extraction._apply_moving_average(pupil_signal, timestamps, is_na, max_window_size)¶

Method applies moving average for pupillometry data. Nan values are remained.

Parameters:

  • pupil_signal (ndarray) – sizes of pupil.

  • timestamps (ndarray) – data recording timestamps.

  • is_na (ndarray) – boolean array representing whether pupil is nan or not.

  • max_window_size (float) – maximum size of smoothing window, in milliseconds.

Return type:

ndarray

Returns:

smoothed pupil sizes.

eyefeatures.preprocessing.blinks_extraction._indices_to_values(onsets, offsets, timestamps, Fs=None)¶

Method converts index-based onsets/offsets to timestamp-based onsets/offsets.

Parameters:

  • onsets (ndarray) – indexes of starting blink indexes.

  • offsets (ndarray) – indexes of ending blink indexes.

  • timestamps (ndarray) – data recording timestamps.

  • Fs (Optional[int]) – sample rate of eye tracker, Hz.

Return type:

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Returns:

onsets, offsets.

eyefeatures.preprocessing.blinks_extraction._interpolate_nans(array, timestamps, gap_dur=inf)¶

Function finds sequences of NaN values, selects ones with duration <= ‘gap_dur’ and linearly interpolates them.

Parameters:

  • array (ndarray) – array with NaNs.

  • timestamps (ndarray) – timestamps of array.

  • gap_dur (float) – threshold gap duration.

Return type:

ndarray

Returns:

array with interpolated gaps.

eyefeatures.preprocessing.blinks_extraction._mask2bounds(mask)¶

Method constructs onset and offset arrays of indices based on mask. Onset - starting index of segment (segment is continuous block of ones), offset - ending index of blink.

Parameters:

mask (ndarray) – boolean array.

Return type:

Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Returns:

[onsets, offsets].

eyefeatures.preprocessing.blinks_extraction._merge_blinks(blink_onsets, blink_offsets, min_dur, min_separation, blink_properties=None)¶

Method merges blinks given onsets and offsets, also collapses too short ones.

Parameters:

  • blink_onsets (Union[List, ndarray]) – onsets of blinks, ms.

  • blink_offsets (Union[List, ndarray]) – offsets of blinks, ms.

  • min_dur (int) – min duration of blink, ms.

  • min_separation (int) – min duration between blinks, ms.

  • blink_properties (Union[List, ndarray, None]) – array of lists, properties of blinks.

Return type:

List[List]

Returns:

array of triples (onset, offset, duration).

eyefeatures.preprocessing.blinks_extraction._nearest_odd_integer(x)¶

Method computes nearest odd integer to ‘x’.

Return type:

int

eyefeatures.preprocessing.blinks_extraction.detect_blinks_eo(eye_openness_signal, timestamps, Fs, gap_dur=30, filter_length=25, min_blink_length=15, min_amplitude=0.1, min_separation=100, return_eo_vel=False)¶

Method detects blinks based on Eye Openness (EO) signal. Taken from https://link.springer.com/article/10.3758/s13428-023-02333-9, code taken from https://github.com/marcus-nystrom/BlinkDetector.

Parameters:

  • eye_openness_signal (ndarray) – eye openness signal.

  • timestamps (ndarray) – data recording timestamps, ms.

  • Fs (int) – sample rate of eye tracker, Hz.

  • gap_dur (int) – max gaps between periods of data loss, ms.

  • filter_length (int) – length of Savitzky-Golay filter, ms.

  • min_blink_length (int) – min length of detected blinks, ms.

  • min_separation (int) – min time interval between detected blinks, ms.

  • min_amplitude (int) – fraction of fully opened eye.

  • return_eo_vel (bool) – if True, then computed velocity of EO signal is returned.

Return type:

Union[DataFrame, Tuple[DataFrame, ndarray]]

Returns:

detected blinks dataframe.

eyefeatures.preprocessing.blinks_extraction.detect_blinks_pupil_missing(pupil_signal, timestamps, min_separation=100, min_dur=20, smoothing_window_size=10, return_mask=False)¶

Method detects blinks based on size of pupil and missing recordings (NaN) in its data. Result is boolean array of the same length as pupil_signal, with 1 indicating blink, 0 - not blink. Taken from [PyTrack paper](https://link.springer.com/article/10.3758/s13428-020-01392-6):

Parameters:

  • pupil_signal (ndarray) – size of right or left pupil.

  • timestamps (ndarray) – data recording timestamps.

  • smoothing_window_size (int) – maximum size of smoothing window, ms.

  • min_separation (int) – min time interval between detected blinks, ms.

  • min_dur (int) – min duration of blink, ms.

  • return_mask (bool) – bool = False

Return type:

Union[DataFrame, Tuple[DataFrame, ndarray]]

Returns:

detected blinks dataframe.

eyefeatures.preprocessing.blinks_extraction.detect_blinks_pupil_vt(pupil_signal, timestamps, Fs, gap_dur=20, min_dur=20, remove_outliers=False, window_len=None, min_pupil_size=2, min_separation=50, return_mask=False)¶

Method detects blinks based on pupil sizes and change of pupil sizes. Taken from https://link.springer.com/article/10.3758/s13428-023-02333-9, code taken from https://github.com/marcus-nystrom/BlinkDetector.

Parameters:

  • pupil_signal (ndarray) – size of right of left pupil, mm.

  • timestamps (ndarray) – data recording timestamps, ms.

  • Fs (int) – sample rate of eye tracker, Hz.

  • gap_dur (int) – max gaps between periods of data loss, ms.

  • min_dur (int) – min duration of blink, ms.

  • remove_outliers (bool) – whether to remove outliers.

  • window_len (Optional[int]) – size of window to use if ‘remove_outliers’ = True.

  • min_pupil_size (int) – min value of pupil size considered to be recorded correctly, mm.

  • min_separation (int) – min time interval between detected blinks, ms.

  • return_mask (bool) – if True, then mask showing blink classification is also returned.

Return type:

Union[DataFrame, Tuple[DataFrame, ndarray]]

Returns:

detected blinks dataframe.

eyefeatures.preprocessing.fixation_extraction module¶

class eyefeatures.preprocessing.fixation_extraction.IDT(x, y, t, min_duration, max_dispersion, distance='euc', pk=None, eps=1e-20)¶

Bases: BaseFixationPreprocessor

Dispersion Threshold Identification. Complexity: O(n * W) for single group, where W is size of maximum window. Worst case is O(n^2) for W = n.

__init__(x, y, t, min_duration, max_dispersion, distance='euc', pk=None, eps=1e-20)¶
_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>¶
_check_params()¶

Method checks that provided data is sufficient to conduct preprocessing.

Return type:

DataFrame

_sklearn_auto_wrap_output_keys = {'transform'}¶
class eyefeatures.preprocessing.fixation_extraction.IHMM(x, y, t, fix2sac=0.05, sac2fix=0.05, fix_distrib='norm', sac_distrib='norm', distrib_params='auto', distance='euc', pk=None, eps=1e-20)¶

Bases: BaseFixationPreprocessor

Hidden Markov Model Identification. Complexity: O(n^2) for single group.

Parameters:

  • fix2sac (float) – probability of transition from fixation to saccade.

  • sac2fix (float) – probability of transition from saccade to fixation.

  • fix_distrib (str) – distribution of fixations.

  • sac_distrib (str) – distribution of saccades.

  • distrib_params (Union[str, Dict[str, float]]) – ‘auto’ for default params and dict {“fixation”: params1, “saccade”: params2}, where “params” are arguments for appropriate scipy.stats function.

__init__(x, y, t, fix2sac=0.05, sac2fix=0.05, fix_distrib='norm', sac_distrib='norm', distrib_params='auto', distance='euc', pk=None, eps=1e-20)¶

_sklearn_auto_wrap_output_keys = {'transform'}¶
_viterbi(observations, states, sp, tp, ep)¶

Computes hidden states vector Q s.t. probability of observing vector ‘observations’ given sp, tp, and ep is maximum.

st ~ states

sp ~ start_probs

tp ~ transition_probs

ep ~ emission_probs

observations ~ velocities

eyefeatures.preprocessing.smoothing module¶

class eyefeatures.preprocessing.smoothing.FIRFilter(x, y, t=None, pk=None, numtaps=81, fs=250, cutoff=100, pass_zero=False, mode='valid', **fir_kw)¶

Bases: BaseSmoothingPreprocessor

FIR filter. Convolution with RIR kernel along ‘x’ and ‘y’. kwargs are passed to scipy.signal.firwin to determine the kernel.

Parameters:

mode (Literal['valid', 'full', 'same']) – parameter of scipy.signal.fftconvolve.

Note

Default values are taken from https://arxiv.org/pdf/2303.02134.

__init__(x, y, t=None, pk=None, numtaps=81, fs=250, cutoff=100, pass_zero=False, mode='valid', **fir_kw)¶

class eyefeatures.preprocessing.smoothing.SavGolFilter(x, y, t=None, pk=None, window_length=11, polyorder=2, **savgol_kw)¶

Bases: BaseSmoothingPreprocessor

Savitzkiy-Golay filter. ‘x’ and ‘y’ directions are filtered independently, time is ignored. Parameters are passed to scipy.signal.savgol_filter.

Default values are taken from https://arxiv.org/pdf/2303.02134.

class eyefeatures.preprocessing.smoothing.WienerFilter(x, y, t=None, pk=None, K=4.3e-05, sigma=0.2, size=11)¶

Bases: BaseSmoothingPreprocessor

Wiener filter. Applied independently along ‘x’ and ‘y’ axis.

Parameters:

  • K (Union[float, Literal['auto']]) – estimate of ratio of noise-to-signal spectra. If ‘auto’, such value of K on grid [-1e-3, 1e-3] with 2e3 values is chosen to minimize PSNR.

  • sigma (float) – std of Gaussian filter.

  • size (int) – length of Gaussian filter.

__init__(x, y, t=None, pk=None, K=4.3e-05, sigma=0.2, size=11)¶

Peak-Signal-to-Noise Ratio. Must be applied to normalized coordinates with maximum value of 1.
